message_1: Consider the universal set U = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find A ∩ B.
message_2: A ∩ B represents the intersection of sets A and B, which includes all the elements that are common to both sets. In this case, A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. The common elements are 2 and 3. Therefore, A ∩ B = {2, 3}.
